title: Tom Bowen (rugby union)
text:
Tom Bowen is an English <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player.
<a href="Brighton">Brighton</a> born, Bowen took up rugby at the age of six in <a href="Lewes">Lewes</a>. Bowen joined <a href="Plymouth%20Albion">Plymouth Albion</a>
in 2012 from <a href="Leicester%20Tigers">Leicester Tigers</a>, originally a centre, he switched to the wing, and scored 6 tries in his first 18 appearances in the <a href="RFU%20Championship">RFU Championship</a>, becoming Plymouth’s young player of the season for 2 seasons consecutively. He became Plymouth Albion’s top try-scorer for the 2013-14 season. Bowen made his England Sevens debut on the <a href="Gold%20Coast%2C%20Australia">Gold Coast, Australia</a> in October 2014.
During the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a> Bowen taught rugby and fitness, both online and in schools alongside England teammates such as <a href="Megan%20Jones%20%28rugby%20union%29">Megan Jones</a>. In June 2021 he was confirmed as the reserve in the Great Britain Rugby Sevens squad for the delayed <a href="2020%20Summer%20Games">2020 Summer Games</a> in <a href="Tokyo">Tokyo</a>.
